revised_title: Observations on the Bills of Mortality at York: Population Growth and Health Improvement
tldr: The author examines the population and mortality data in York from 1735 to 1776, observing a general improvement in population growth and health. Factors contributing to this improvement include better disease prevention methods, increased attention to infant care, and urban development improvements such as widened streets, new paving, and the construction of locks to maintain river cleanliness.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Demography
